what do you mean by this?

content.body: Usually when writing a module loader, you only need to do two passes over the graph
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Usually when writing a module loader, you only need to do two passes over the graph

content.body: one pass to load the modules, and another pass to execute them
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: one pass to load the modules, and another pass to execute them

content.body: the specification currently already has two passes
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: the specification currently already has two passes

content.body: just wondering if we can condense that
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: just wondering if we can condense that

content.body: it'd be nice if we could, but the three passes existed in ES+HTML before, didn't they?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: it'd be nice if we could, but the three passes existed in ES+HTML before, didn't they?

content.body: Yeah I guess once you add HTML that's three certainly
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Yeah I guess once you add HTML that's three certainly

content.body: this patch is all about just moving the logic from HTML to ES without changing semantics
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: this patch is all about just moving the logic from HTML to ES without changing semantics

content.body: I honestly don't know how we could move linking to be on-line during fetching and parsing, but maybe you see a way
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I honestly don't know how we could move linking to be on-line during fetching and parsing, but maybe you see a way

content.body: that makes sense, I guess the distinction in the iteration approach is based on that async / sync difference as well
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: that makes sense, I guess the distinction in the iteration approach is based on that async / sync difference as well

content.body: what do you mean by that?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: what do you mean by that?

content.body: the InnerModuleLinking algorithm is a recursive functional approach, while the new logic carries a payload state and a continuation system. They're two ways of doing the same thing it seems?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: the InnerModuleLinking algorithm is a recursive functional approach, while the new logic carries a payload state and a continuation system. They're two ways of doing the same thing it seems?

content.body: oh, yes, that's related to being async
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: oh, yes, that's related to being async

content.body: and the logic is really cribbed from HTML IIRC
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: and the logic is really cribbed from HTML IIRC
